Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge's decision met the legal residence requirements under the Citizenship Act
Credibility_Assessment: Abdallah provided vague and incomplete evidence
Evidence_Type: Residency documentation, addresses, proof of physical presence
Legal_Provision: Residence requirement of 1095 days in four years prior to application
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of the citizenship judge's decision
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies and ambiguities in residency evidence
Evidence_Ignored: Mismatched addresses, lack of proof for certain periods
Legal_Standard: Permanent resident must reside in Canada for at least 1095 days in the four years preceding application
Decision_Outcome: Approval of citizenship application initially, later overturned
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable decision due to inadequate justification
Outcome_of_Review: Referred back for reconsideration by another citizenship judge
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of sufficient proof of residency
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to address inconsistencies in evidence
Omission_Type: Failure to assess residency evidence thoroughly
